articles.title: Chinese-made Huawei tower could breach US nuclear arsenal, hints FBI probe - Hindustan Times
articles.description: The Chinese government has denied charges of espionage on the American soil. Huawei also denied that the tower is capable of operating in any spectrum allocated to the US defence department, CNN reported. | World News
articles.content:
The Federal Bureau of Investigation has uncovered Chinese-made Huawei equipment on cell towers near the US military bases in Midwest, CNN reported.

articles.title: Zoe Holohan's diary: I dread the month of July with every ounce of my being. This is when my nightmares return in full force - Independent.ie
articles.description: Four days into the month that I dread the most and I’d hardly registered the timing until I sent a message. As I hit send on my ‘Happy Independence Day’ message to my American pal, it suddenly hit me. July was already here.

articles.title: 'He never did anything halfway': Montreal volunteer fighter dies in Ukraine, mother says - CBC.ca
articles.description: Émile-Antoine Roy-Sirois, 31, died on July 18, according to his friend, Adriel Martinez, an American volunteer in Ukraine. Roy-Sirois left Montreal in March to lend support to Ukrainian forces after the country was invaded by Russia.
articles.content:
Marie-France Sirois hadn't heard news about her son for days, until his best friend in the army called.
"I knew it was the end," she said.
Her son, Émile-Antoine Roy-Sirois, 31, died on July 18, ac… [+3084 chars]

articles.title: Diana Kennedy, Authority on Mexican Cooking, Dies at 99 - The New York Times
articles.description: Her books taught Americans about the regional nature of the cuisine. Also: “There is always someone who wants to know how to clean an iguana, so why not?”
articles.content: She took a dim view of chefs and writers who did not do the same, and her criticism could be withering. Theyve not done the travel and the research that Ive done, she told Saveur. None of them, not o… [+1751 chars]
